thread.title: Suspend Anne Waiguru, Bomet Governor Isaac Ruto says
thread.title_full: Suspend Anne Waiguru, Bomet Governor Isaac Ruto says

title: Suspend Anne Waiguru, Bomet Governor Isaac Ruto says
text:
Bomet Governor Isaac Ruto has called for the suspension of Devolution Cabinet Secretary Anne Waiguru over the National Youth Service (NYS) scandal. 
He accused the Jubilee Administration of applying double standards in dealing with corruption. 
He claimed Cabinet secretaries who were linked to corrupt dealings were suspended pending investigations and wondered why Ms Waiguru was still in office. 
Mr Ruto has now joined the list of United Republican Party (URP) leaders pushing for suspension of the Cabinet Secretary. 
Speaking to the Nation in Kericho, the governor claimed Ms Waiguru may interfere with Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission (EACC) investigations over the alleged loss of Sh791 million from the NYS. 
“You cannot apply one law on some ministers and a different one on others. If investigations are ongoing, Ms Waiguru should have stepped aside when police started investigating her docket to prove that the law is applicable to all” Mr Ruto said. 
URP leaders led by Nandi Hills MP Alfred Keter have called for the removal of Ms Waiguru over allegations of abuse of office and misuse of funds. 
Mr Keter has already drafted a motion seeking to impeach her. 
On Saturday, Mr Ruto said President Uhuru Kenyatta has put himself at risk of impeachment through some of his actions. 
“There are many instances where the President has disregarded courts orders. Everyone must obey the law and respect the courts,” he said. 
He urged President Kenyatta to 'lead from the front’ by respecting court orders.
